file_content.text: Thank you again for all you've done.
Jedi! The houses are in an uproar--there's to be no end to the war. What happened at the summit?
Peace seems to be a lost cause on Alderaan.
I couldn't stop it.
Yes, it does seem that way. But perhaps we can hope for a day when there will be no need for an army?
Master Sidonie pit the houses against each other.
It was all Sidonie's doing.
I only met her once, but that seems so unlike her.
How should I know? I was only there to find Master Sidonie.
Beats me.
Of course. Alderaan's meager concerns must pale in comparison to Jedi business.
Still, I am hopeful that House Teral will weather the storm with the help of their new ally.
For that, I owe you thanks, Jedi.
Jedi! I heard that a motion passed to strip Ulgo of all his lands and titles once the war's ended, and it's all thanks to you.
I represented House Teral to the best of my ability.
I was only doing my duty.
Better than I dared hope.
I worry that I prevented one war only to stir up another.
I hope it wasn't a mistake.
Any peace on Alderaan will be far more secure with Ulgo exiled.
Ulgo will get what they deserve.
It's only just.
This has worked out better than I imagined it could.
With Organa as an ally and Ulgo soon to be no more, House Teral may soon return to glory indeed.
As promised, with the authority I possess, I proclaim you a lord of Alderaan and award you these credits for your service to House Teral.
I'm sorry, but it wouldn't be right for a Jedi to hold such a title.
I can't accept a title.
Fair enough. I hope you will at least accept the credits.
Thank you.
The pleasure is all mine, Jedi.
Finally, I get some proper recognition.
Very appropriate, I think.
You've certainly earned it.
Jedi! I hear the summit has agreed to continue peace talks.
Thankfully, the delegates saw reason.
Cooler heads prevailed.
Thankfully indeed. We all owe a debt of thanks to you and Master Sidonie.
There is hope for peace in spite of Master Sidonie's best attempts to create a war.
No thanks to Master Sidonie.
She did what? That seems so unlike her. Thank goodness you were there.
Hopefully the houses will continue to put aside their differences.
If all goes well, yes.
We all have you and Master Sidonie to thank.
My only regret is that there's no talk of removing House Ulgo's noble status and lands once the war's over.
I didn't want to risk undoing the peace by inciting another conflict.
The peace was too fragile.
That was probably the wisest course.
The opportunity never arose.
I didn't get a chance.
I understand. I imagine it was a very busy summit.
You should just be thankful peace is even possible.
Don't push your luck.
I didn't mean to criticize. I am grateful for all you've done.
I just can't feel safe as long as Ulgo commands an army.
But what am I saying? House Teral is far safer now with peace in view and Organa as an ally than we ever were, and I have you to thank.
My pleasure.
It was nothing.
Then I'll take my leave.
You've done House Teral an invaluable service. I hope you will come visit us again.
Good luck at the summit, Jedi.
I spoke with the rest of House Teral, and the decision was unanimous: You are our new delegate! Congratulations!
Now I need to get to the summit and find Master Sidonie.
Good.
So how do I get to the summit?
Where do I go?
Well, that's something I'm not entirely clear on.
Goodness knows, I've wasted enough valuable time getting to this point.
Finally.
I know it's been a hardship, but House Teral is truly grateful.
I have the packet the last delegate was supposed to use, but I don't understand its contents--some coordinates and a data spike.
It appears that you need to go to those coordinates and do something with the data spike?
Excuse me, then; I must get to the summit right away.
I must be going.
I just hope she's not planning any tricks.
This better not be a trap.
We'll soon find out, won't we?
There's only one way to know.
Just one moment, Jedi. If I may... we would like to ask one last thing.
There will never be peace for House Teral as long as House Ulgo exists.
If you're able to use your influence as a Jedi to convince the summit to strip House Ulgo, ensure they never hold a title again, we'd show our gratitude.
I don't want to do anything that will destabilize the peace.
I'll think about it.
Deal.
Thank you, Jedi. We very much appreciate all you've done.
I'm sorry, but I have to do what's best for Alderaan.
No way.
Please, Jedi. House Teral has security now, but we still require justice.
Good luck at the summit. I hope you find Master Sidonie well and that all goes smoothly.
Welcome back, Jedi. I owe you thanks.
I don't understand. Why would you want to risk it?
Lord Teral, without risk, there can be no glory.
The only way to avoid risk is to avoid war, but that's not very effective or fun, is it?
No, I suppose it isn't.
Ah, Jedi! Welcome back! General Vox and I were just discussing strategy.
We haven't stood this proud since our house was young and building its first alliance with House Panteer. Thank you, Jedi.
It was your plan, I merely executed.
Give yourself credit.
But we couldn't have done any of it without you.
It was my honor.
You have our gratitude.
Just make me your delegate already.
Skip the thanks.
It's already been taken care of.
Lew Organa and my daughter Fasha are getting acquainted as we speak.
We must save Lew Organa, or the whole alliance goes to pieces. Hurry to House Rist.
An Organa-Teral alliance would be disastrous to Ulgo. They must have ordered Rist to kidnap Lew Organa to stop the alliance.
I'll rescue Lew Organa, I promise.
I'll find him.
Surely Organa has planned a reprisal.
What's Organa doing about it?
House Organa is planning to attack House Ulgo, and if they do, casualties will be great and peace impossible.
So let's get an army together and attack Ulgo.
Time for war!
No! We can't do that.
The entire peace summit will collapse and with it, our hopes of an alliance.
But if you are able to rescue Lew Organa on House Teral's behalf, we can still prevent a battle and secure our alliance.
I will do my utmost.
I won't fail.
I have come to expect nothing less.
Those assassins will be no match for a Jedi.
This'll be easy.
Use caution, Jedi.
Why can't you people ever help yourselves?
You're all pathetic.
I was under the impression you had agreed to help us.
Rist's assassins are uncanny, and you'll be going right into their nest.
Be careful, but hurry. We need to beat the Organa attack, or everything falls apart.
Jedi! Thank goodness I've reached you. There's good news and bad news.
The good news is, everyone's heard how you impressed Astar Vox and broke the siege--including Organa. They've agreed to the marriage-alliance.
The good news is, everyone's heard how you killed Astar Vox and broke the siege--including Organa. They've agreed to the marriage-alliance.
Now, the bad news: Lew Organa has been kidnapped!
Then we have to get him back.
We must save him.
Exactly. The kidnappers were from Ulgo's ally, House Rist--Alderaan's most deadly assassins.
Who is Lew Organa again?
Lew Organa?
Hallam Organa's younger brother. His marriage to my daughter Fasha was to be the linchpin of the whole alliance.
I fail to see why this is important.
And I care because?
Are you kidding? Lew Organa is vital to the whole alliance!
This is clearly Ulgo's doing. The kidnappers were from their ally, House Rist.
Speak to Astar Vox and get him on our side.
Are you Lord Teral? I'm here to become your delegate to the peace summit.
That's correct.
Jedi! Yes, Organa told me you'd be coming, but well, this is, well, it's complicated.
The whole house needs to approve a new delegate, and well, they say they won't approve a stranger.
He may be a stranger, but he's a Jedi. I should think you'd be grateful for his assistance!
She may be a stranger, but she's a Jedi. I should think you'd be grateful for her assistance!
Is not stranger. Is Herald of Scorekeeper. Great Jedi.
But, Father! Did you tell them she's a Jedi?
But, Father! Did you tell them he's a Jedi?
Yes, of course, but House Teral has fallen so hard, we don't even have the strength to hope.
It will take more than my word to convince them.
It is my privilege as a Jedi to serve House Teral in whatever way I can.
I will do what is necessary.
From now until the summit's end, I will live, sleep, eat and breathe House Teral's interests.
I'll be devoted to your cause.
Really? Well, all right, then!
After our original delegate was murdered and Ulgo drove us back into this hole, I'd almost given up hope myself.
In other words, you're all too full of self-pity to help yourselves.
Sounds pathetic.
It wasn't always this way, Jedi. But then our original delegate was killed, and Ulgo drove us back to this hole....
I'm sorry, you're right. As my daughter Fasha says--no good can come of self-pity.
Just tell the Jedi our plan, Father.
Right. House Teral's current position is precarious. Our enemy, House Ulgo, seeks our destruction. Their army is at our gate.
House Teral needs a strong ally if we are to survive. We need House Organa.
An alliance with Organa seems doable.
Organa spoke highly of you.
We had hoped so.
I will speak to the Organas--I'm sure I can convince them of an alliance.
Let me take care of it.
Well, that's the hitch.
And my job is?
We proposed a marriage-alliance to House Organa. My daughter Fasha would marry Lew Organa.
But House Teral is weak, and powers within Organa fear we'd drag them down with us.
We need to prove to Organa that House Teral can defend itself against its enemies.
We need a plan. Tell me, what are your resources?
We should get started then.
I'm afraid you're our only resource, Jedi.
If you can defend yourself, do you really need an alliance?
Doesn't that miss the point?
We only need to defend ourselves for a short time to win the confidence of our prospective allies.
Consider Ulgo dead.
Jedi, it's your diplomatic skills that we need right now.
As I've said, House Ulgo's forces are at our gates, threatening to drive us out of our last holding.
But Ulgo's commanding general--Astar Vox--is a mercenary with a loose definition of loyalty. If we can reach him, turn him, we can break the siege.
I will begin negotiations with Astar Vox immediately.
I will bring him to our side.
No problem.
This approach seems overly complicated. Can I use my lightsaber instead?
Can't we just kill him?
Killing him would break the siege, but my hope is that Astar Vox can help House Teral build up its armies.
If he won't be bought, by all means kill him. But if you can bring him to our side, House Teral's security will be the better for it.
I will keep my lightsaber sheathed.
Then I'll keep him alive.
I will see what I can do.
I'll try not to kill him.
I will do whatever gets the job done fastest.
I can't afford to waste time.
We have no time to waste. I will contact House Organa the moment I hear that the siege is broken.
I'm sorry, but I don't have time to talk.
Good. We must hurry. Organa is preparing for an assault on House Rist, but that can only end in disaster.
Be careful, but hurry. Organa is planning a reprisal on House Rist, and that can only end in disaster.
